titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Family papers, Home Movies and Newsreels
A Guide to the Rockefeller Family papers, Home Movies and Newsreels FA1303

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-01 01:16:28 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Family papers, Home Movies and Newsreels

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 113 films created by Rockefeller family members and 56 newsreels featuring the Rockefellers.

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller Sr. Family Home Movies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John D. Rockefeller Sr. home movies between 1924-1929. Types of records include: films

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller Sr. Hosting at The Casements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ormond Beach, FL. John D. Rockefeller Sr. hosting at The Casements: Guests exit house; John D. Rockefeller Sr. exits house; addresses camera; greets guests on lawn. Greetings are repeated three times.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 18 frames per second. Primary source: AV 1355.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 18 frames per second. Primary source: AV 1355.

did.unittitle: Rockefellers in Ormond Beach

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ormond Beach, FL: John D. Rockefeller Sr. at Ormond Union Church; views of Ormond Beach Hotel. John D. Rockefeller Sr.: with boy scouts, with a group at country club, golfing, and on mule cart. A costumed chariot race; John D. Rockefeller Jr. on horseback.
At Casements: John D. Rockefeller Sr. on cart; butler; yard workers; dogs; David Rockefeller on bike; John D. Rockefeller Sr. passing dimes in park; Ormond Garage race car; beach and landscape shots

processinfo.head: Processing Information

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller Sr. in St Augustine

scopecontent.p: St. Augustine, FL: John D. Rockefeller Sr. in St Augustine on various occasions: alone and with Abby Aldrich Rockefeller and group; Old mill; group outside hotel, watch parade and band.

John D. Rockefeller Sr. alone at Castillo de San Marcos; Henry Flagler Memorial; giving dimes to men. View of swamp; Bridge of Lions; group at Castillo; John D. Rockefeller Sr. at Henry M. Flagler statue; shots of burning sugar cane fields.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Family Trip to France

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlantic crossings, various France locations. Family Trip to France: on ship – Nelson Rockefeller, David Rockefeller, and John D. Rockefeller III play games; French villages; David Rockefeller, Winthrop Rockefeller row boat; with goats; David Rockefeller catches bugs at Fontainebleau; Versailles; return voyage – Nelson Rockefeller with girl, Nelson Rockefeller, Laurance Rockefeller play games; views of NYC harbor and skyline.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 18 frames per second. Primary source: AV 86.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from access at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: This Is America — Rockefeller Center

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 24 frames per second. Primary source: AV 1259. Repair Source: AV 1088.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: RKO Radio Pictures. Rockefeller Center: This Is America, July 28 1944. (II, 10)

This film provides a detailed guided tour through the recently-completed complex. From the outside to the inside, from street-level to observation deck, from machines far below the street to a cocktail bar in the top floor, the cameras move through the buildings. Viewers are made acquainted with the high-speed elevators, with the crowds of tourists and guided tours, with the rooftop gardens, and with such technical services as the restaurants, air conditioning plants, window and floor cleaning operations, locksmith shops, and the post office.

A comparatively long sequence introduces the Radio City Music Hall: on view are the dancing Rockettes at leisure, at practice on the roof, and on the stage of the Music Hall. Special attention is given to the backstage activities, including scene design, choreography, rehearsal, and technical aspects of production. Similarly, on a tour of the NBC radio broadcasting facilities, viewers are taken "backstage" to see the technicians, actors, sound effects men, announcers, orchestras, and control rooms. In the experimental television studios, the relatively unfamiliar invention is introduced as "radio with eyes."
